comment.author: 10799299@N00
comment._content: These are all entries in the sculpture contest mentioned here: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F2071FFF3E5A15...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Irene Marcellus was 15 when she entered this sculpture in this "Friends of Young Artists" competition (it did not win a prize). She was at that time a famous child model and would go on to be a Ziegfield Girl and actress. news.google.com/newspapers?nid=336&dat=19160126&i... www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=395713 This contest was the initial exhibition of "Friends of Young Artists" a group of which Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney (Mrs. Harry Payne Whitney) was a founder. This was one of her initial art patronage projects, part of the evolution of the Whitney Museum of American Art, which she founded in 1930. books.google.com/books?id=WYaRX58a0_IC&pg=PA758&l... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gertrude_Vanderbilt_Whitney

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for this information about the contest. We'll add some of it to the record the next time we update.
